intro: Tofieldia calyculata f. ramosa, commonly known as the ramose tofieldia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit and features dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in woodland areas. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. The ramosa form is distinguished by its more branched inflorescence compared to the typical form of the species.
